catplat.adsorption.build module

class catplat.adsorption.build.ComplexBidentateBuilder(slab, adsorbate, bonds, connectivity=None, avg_coord_num=None, sites_idx=None, rotation=None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ComplexBuilder

Creates bidentate adsorption complexes. :param Slab: Slab to be adsorbed on. :type Slab: Atoms :param Adsorabte: Adsorbate to be adsorbed. :type Adsorabte: GratomsWrapper :param bonds: Bonds object containing the bonds of the adsorbate. :type bonds: Bonds :param connectivity: List of connectivities to filter for. :type connectivity: Union[List[Connectivity], None] :param avg_coord_num: List of average coordination numbers to filter for. :type avg_coord_num: Union[List[AverageCoordinationNumber], None] :param sites_idx: List of sites to filter for. :type sites_idx: Union[List[Sites], None] :param rotation: Bidentate adsorption does not support rotation. :type rotation: None :param unique: Whether to filter for unique sites. :type unique: bool :param bond_length_buffer: Buffer to add to bond length when calculating adsorption coordinates. :type bond_length_buffer: Union[float, None] :param stol: Tolerance for identical structures. :type stol: float :param num_procs: Number of processes to use for grouping of identical structures. :type num_procs: int

DENTICITY = 2

get_unique_edges()[source]
property symmetrical_along_bond: bool
class catplat.adsorption.build.ComplexBuilder(slab: IAtomsWrapper, adsorbate: GratomsWrapper, bonds: Bonds, connectivity: List[Connectivity] | None = None, avg_coord_num: List[AverageCoordinationNumber] | None = None, sites_idx: List[Sites] | None = None, unique: bool = True, bond_length_buffer: float | None = None, min_distance_to_slab=2, stol: float = 0.18, num_procs: int = 8)[source]

Bases: ABC

Manages the logic for Complex building. ComplexMonodentateBuilder, ComplexBidentateBuilder, and ComplexMultiBuilder are subclasses containing the logic for monodentate and bidentate, and monodentate(multiple) adsorption respectively

Use ComplexBuilder.from_adsorbate(**kwargs) to instantiate ComplexBuilder classes.

Parameters:

  • slab (Atoms) – Slab to be adsorbed on.

  • adsorbate (GratomsWrapper) – Adsorbate to be adsorbed.

  • bonds (Bonds) – Bonds object containing the bonds of the adsorbate.

  • connectivity (Union[List[Connectivity], None]) – List of connectivities to filter for.

  • avg_coord_num (Union[List[AverageCoordinationNumber], None]) – List of average coordination numbers to filter for.

  • unique (bool) – Whether to filter for unique sites.

  • bond_length_buffer (Union[float, None]) – Buffer to add to bond length when calculating adsorption coordinates.

  • stol (float) – Tolerance for identical structures.

  • num_procs (int) – Number of processes to use for grouping of identical structures.

  • min_distance_to_slab (float) – Minimum distance of any adsorbate atom to the slab.

DENTICITY = NotImplemented
property adsorbate_decorated_slab: Atoms

Shows all adsorption sites on the slab that matches selected criteria. Atom indexes matches site_index.

property adsorption_sites_indices: List[int]

Returns the indices of the adsorption sites.

abstract build() → list[source]

Subclasses to implement adsorption logic.

property filtered_lattice: SitesLattice

Filters SitesLattice to return sites of interest. Generic filter which only filters for sites in connectivities/avg_coord_num/sites_idx. Does not explicitly filter for the exact site cluster attributes.

classmethod from_adsorbate(adsorbate, slab, bonds, **kwargs)[source]

More intuitive way for users to instantiate ComplexBuilder.

property lattice: SitesLattice

Important to keep this as cached_property as it is expensive to evaluate avg_coord_num in SitesLattice

property surface_gratoms: GratomsWrapper

Get slab with surface atoms, adapted from SlabGenerator.get_slab_basis. Converted to gratoms.

class catplat.adsorption.build.ComplexMonodentateBuilder(adsorbate, slab, bonds, rotation: list | None = None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ComplexBuilder

Creates monodentate adsorption complexes.

Parameters:

  • slab (Atoms) – Slab to be adsorbed on.

  • adsorbate (GratomsWrapper) – Adsorbate to be adsorbed.

  • bonds (Bonds) – Bonds object containing the bonds of the adsorbate.

  • connectivity (Union[List[Connectivity], None]) – List of connectivities to filter for.

  • avg_coord_num (Union[List[AverageCoordinationNumber], None]) – List of average coordination numbers to filter for.

  • sites_idx (Union[List[Sites], None]) – List of sites to filter for.

  • rotation (list) – List of angles to rotate the adsorbate by. Defaults to ROTATION.

  • unique (bool) – Whether to filter for unique sites.

  • bond_length_buffer (Union[float, None]) – Buffer to add to bond length when calculating adsorption coordinates.

  • stol (float) – Tolerance for identical structures.

  • num_procs (int) – Number of processes to use for grouping of identical structures.

DENTICITY = 1

property bond

Convenient property to refer to bond since bonds will always be length 1.

class catplat.adsorption.build.ComplexMultiBuilder(slab, adsorbate, bonds: Bonds, quantity: int, unique: bool = False, distance_tol: float = 0.8, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ComplexBuilder

Creates complexes with multiple monodentate species. # TODO: allow coadsorption for >1 adsorption species i.e. CO + O. via new matrix [[CO CO],[O CO],[CO O],[O O]] :param slab: Slab to be adsorbed on. :type slab: Atoms :param adsorabte: Adsorbate to be adsorbed. :type adsorabte: GratomsWrapper :param bonds: Bonds object containing the bonds of the adsorbate. :type bonds: Bonds :param connectivity: List of connectivities to filter for. :type connectivity: Union[List[Connectivity], None] :param avg_coord_num: List of average coordination numbers to filter for. :type avg_coord_num: Union[List[AverageCoordinationNumber], None] :param sites_idx: List of sites to filter for. :type sites_idx: Union[List[Sites], None] :param quantity: Number of adsorbates to be adsorbed. :type quantity: int :param unique: Whether to filter for unique sites. :type unique: bool :param distance_tol: Tolerance for distance between adsorbates. Defaults to 0.8. :type distance_tol: float :param bond_length_buffer: Buffer to add to bond length when calculating adsorption coordinates. :type bond_length_buffer: Union[float, None] :param stol: Tolerance for identical structures. :type stol: float :param num_procs: Number of processes to use for grouping of identical structures. :type num_procs: int

class catplat.adsorption.complex.Complex(atoms: AtomsWrapper, adsorbates: List[Adsorbate])[source]

Bases: object

Complex object representing an adsorbate + slab system.

Instantiate Complex object via: 1) Complex.from_atoms_and_adsorbate_indices() -> Single adsorbate 2) Complex.from_complexes() -> Multiple adsorbates

Parameters:

  • atoms (AtomsWrapper) – AtomsWrapper object of the complex.

  • adsorbates (List[Adsorbate]) – List of Adsorbate objects.

catplat.adsorption.sites module

This module contains the SitesLattice object.

class catplat.adsorption.sites.SitesLattice(sites: AdsorptionSites, selected_sites: ndarray | None = None, precomputed_hash: List[int] | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

This class is a wrapper class for catkit.gen.adsorption.AdsorptionSites and focuses on analysis of the slab surface attributes. In the documentation, “site” refers to a single site on the surface. “Edge” refers to 2 sites (generally bidentate) and “cluster” refers to a group of sites.

For example:

# SitesLattice class can be instatiated from a slab structure using the class method: sites = SitesLattice.from_slab(slab) # Site properties avg_coord_num = sites.avg_coord_num # Average coordination number of surface atoms decorated_slab = sites.decorated_slab() # Atoms object showing all adsorption sites

_sites

Copy of Catkit’s AdsorptionSites object.

Type:

AdsorptionSites

top_coords

List of top sites.

Type:

list

slab

Copy of the slab.

Type:

Atoms

cell

Copy of the cell.

Type:

list

avg_coord_num

Average coordination number of the surface atoms.

Type:

list

filter_direction(point, vec, dir_tol=0.5)[source]

Return sites that are in the same XY vector direction as the XY dissociation vector. :param point: Coordinates of a point to filter sites from. :type point: list :param vec: XY dissociation vector. :type vec: list :param dir_tol: value between -1 and 1. i.e., vec=(0,-1,0), tol: {-1:0°-360°, 0:90°-270°, 1:270°}. :type dir_tol: float

Returns:

filter_distances(point, min_distance=0, max_distance=100, mic=False)[source]

Filters off sites that are too near or too far from point. :param point: Coordinates of a point to filter sites from. :type point: list :param min_distance: Sites < min_distance will be deselected :type min_distance: float :param max_distance: Sites > max_distance will be deselected :type max_distance: float :param mic: Whether to use minimum image convention. Defaults to False. :type mic: bool

Returns:

Returns a new SitesLattice object with updated selected_sites.

filter_edges_avg_coord_num(edges: list, avg_coord_num: list, reverse: bool = False) → list[source]

Filter a list of edges based on matching avg_coord_num. Site(A-B) must match site A-B exactly or B-A if reverse is True.

Parameters:

  • edges (list) – List of edge.

  • avg_coord_num (list) – List of avg_coord_num to match.

  • reverse (bool) – Whether to reverse the avg_coord_num criteria. Defaults to False.

Returns:

List of edges that matches the avg_coord_num criteria.

Return type:

edges (list)

Filter edges based on matching connectivities. Site(A-B) must match site A-B exactly or B-A if reverse is True.

Parameters:

  • connectivities (list) – List of connectivities to match.

  • reverse (bool) – Whether to reverse the connectivity criteria. Defaults to False.

Returns:

List of edges that matches the connectivity criteria.

Return type:

edges (list)

classmethod from_slab(slab, tol=1e-05, angle_tol=0.01)[source]

Create adsorption sites from slab. :param slab: Gratoms object that represents the slab. :type slab: Gratoms :param tol: Tolerance that goes into AdsorptionSites. Defaults to 1E-5. :type tol: float :param angle_tol: Tolerance for right angle detection via testing of the inner product,

which ranges from 0 - 1). Defaults to 0.05.

Raises:

ValueError – If slab does not have surface atoms.

get_sites_info(sites=None) → NamedTuple[source]

Returns the properties of a list of sites/clusters.

Single sites are treated as clusters of length 1:

i.e., SitesInfo.coordinates[0] refers to each cluster, SitesInfo.coordinates[0][0] refers to the first site in the cluster.

Parameters:

sites (list) – List of site indices. Defaults to self.selected_sites.

Returns:

NamedTuple containing the coordinates, connectivity, avg_coord_num for the sites.

Return type:

SitesInfo (namedtuple)

new(selected_sites: ndarray, precomputed_hash=None)[source]

Returns a new instance of SitesLattice with updated selected_sites.

Use caching as new is called many times in filter functions, creating new instances of SitesLattice, and each new instance has to recompute the unique sites in cell, which is slow. Caching allows us to reuse the same instance of SitesLattice whenever we filter, which is much faster.

Parameters:

  • selected_sites (list) – List of site indices.

  • precomputed_hash (list) – List of precomputed hashes for each site. Defaults to None.

property sites_hash: list

Returns an integer hash for each site in cell.

property sites_in_cell: List[int]

Returns the indices of the sites that are in the unit cell.

property sites_in_cell_atoms: AtomsWrapper

AtomsWrapper object representing the lattice of sites in the unit cell.

sort_sites_by_distances(point=None)[source]

Sorts the site indices to the distance from point. Sorting allows for equivalent sites in the center to be selected. :param point: Coordinates of a point to sort sites from. Defaults to slab’s center of mass. :type point: list

Returns:
